alert.note: Alert for Eastern Monmouth; Middlesex; Western Monmouth (New Jersey) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 27 at 12:12AM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Monmouth and southeastern Middlesex Counties through 1245 AM EDT... At 1212 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Yorketown, or 15 miles southeast of New Brunswick, moving northeast at 45 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Long Branch, Sandy Hook, Middletown, Old Bridge, Howell, Marlboro, Manalapan, Tinton Falls, Holmdel, Red Bank, Keansburg, Matawan, Highlands, Farmingdale, Brownville, East Freehold, Robertsville, West Freehold, Adelphia and Yorketown. This includes Garden State Parkway between mile markers 102 and 123. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
